summary: This document is an invoice from FedEx addressed to Epstein & Co Inc for transportation charges incurred on April 22, 1999. The invoice details a total charge of $13.23, which was rebated to the account of Epstein & Co Inc. It includes information about the sender and recipient of the package, as well as payment details.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as the owner of Epstein & Co Inc, which is the entity billed for the FedEx services.

persons.name: Miranda J Ellison
persons.context: Miranda J Ellison is noted as the sender of the package that incurred the transportation charges.

persons.name: Beverly Levy
persons.context: Beverly Levy is identified as the recipient of the package sent via FedEx.

connections.description: Miranda J Ellison is associated with Epstein & Co Inc, indicating a possible employer-employee relationship.
Miranda J Ellison sent a package to Beverly Levy, indicating a business relationship.

locations: 17 State St, New York City, NY 10034
keyFacts: The invoice is dated April 22, 1999, and details transportation charges of $13.23.
The charges were initially billed to a different payor and were rebated to Epstein & Co Inc.
The sender of the package was Miranda J Ellison, and the recipient was Beverly Levy.
The invoice indicates that payment is due by May 7, 1999.
The document includes multiple pages detailing the charges and payment type.
